title: Indian Festivals Calendar 2026 - State-wise Festival Guide for Tailors
meta_description: Complete Indian festival calendar 2026 with state-wise festivals. Plan your tailoring business around major festivals like Diwali, Pongal, Durga Puja, Onam, and more.
excerpt: Plan your tailoring business around India's vibrant festivals. This comprehensive state-wise calendar helps you prepare for peak seasons when customers need traditional attire.
author: CuttingMaster Team
content: ## Introduction India is a land of festivals, and each celebration brings a surge in demand for traditional clothing. As a tailor or boutique owner, understanding the festival calendar is essential for business planning. This guide covers major festivals across Indian states, helping you prepare inventory, manage workload, and maximize your business during peak seasons. ## Why Festival Calendar Matters for Tailors Festivals are when Indians invest most in new clothes. Understanding the calendar helps you: - **Stock fabrics in advance** - Popular fabrics sell out before major festivals - **Plan your workload** - Avoid last-minute rush by managing orders early - **Offer timely promotions** - Attract customers with festival-specific deals - **Prepare traditional styles** - Each festival has preferred clothing styles ## Major Pan-India Festivals 2026 ### Makar Sankranti / Pongal (January 14-15) **States:** All India, especially Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka, Gujarat **Traditional Wear:** - South India: Silk sarees, pattu pavadai for girls - Gujarat: Chaniya choli, traditional ghagras - North India: New clothes in bright colors **Tailor Tip:** Start preparing from December. Silk blouse orders peak 2-3 weeks before. ### Republic Day (January 26) **States:** All India **Traditional Wear:** - Tricolor themed outfits - School uniforms - Cultural performance costumes ### Maha Shivaratri (February 26) **States:** All India, especially Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka **Traditional Wear:** - Simple, traditional attire - White and saffron colors popular ### Holi (March 14) **States:** North India, especially UP, Bihar, Rajasthan, MP **Traditional Wear:** - White kurtas (for playing Holi) - Colorful traditional outfits for celebrations ### Ugadi / Gudi Padwa (March 30) **States:** Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka, Maharashtra **Traditional Wear:** - New silk sarees and blouses - Traditional half-sarees for young women - Kurta pajamas for men **Tailor Tip:** This is Telugu/Kannada New Year - orders start 3-4 weeks early. ### Ram Navami (April 6) **States:** All India **Traditional Wear:** - Yellow and saffron colored outfits - Traditional wear for temple visits ### Vishu (April 14) **States:** Kerala **Traditional Wear:** - Kerala kasavu sarees and settu mundu - Traditional white and gold combinations ### Bihu (April 14-15) **States:** Assam **Traditional Wear:** - Mekhela chador for women - Dhoti and gamosa for men ### Eid ul-Fitr (March 30-31) **States:** All India **Traditional Wear:** - Salwar kameez and sharara sets - Anarkalis and gharara - Men's kurta pajamas and sherwanis **Tailor Tip:** Start preparations from mid-Ramadan. Orders peak last 2 weeks. ### Rath Yatra (June 26) **States:** Odisha, West Bengal **Traditional Wear:** - Traditional Odia sarees - Sambalpuri and Bomkai patterns ### Raksha Bandhan (August 9) **States:** North India, Gujarat, Maharashtra **Traditional Wear:** - Coordinated sibling outfits - Traditional kurtas and sarees ### Janmashtami (August 16) **States:** All India, especially UP, Gujarat, Maharashtra **Traditional Wear:** - Krishna-themed children's costumes - Traditional Indian wear ### Onam (August 28 - September 8) **States:** Kerala **Traditional Wear:** - Kerala kasavu sarees - Set sarees and mundu - Traditional white with gold border **Tailor Tip:** Kerala's biggest festival - prepare from early August. ### Ganesh Chaturthi (August 27) **States:** Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka **Traditional Wear:** - Traditional silk sarees - Ethnic wear for pandal visits ### Durga Puja / Navratri (October 1-10) **States:** West Bengal, Gujarat, All India **Traditional Wear:** - West Bengal: Designer sarees, traditional Bengali wear - Gujarat: Chaniya choli, traditional garba outfits - North India: Nine different colored outfits for nine days **Tailor Tip:** Biggest festival season - start preparing from September. Heavy workload expected. ### Dussehra (October 10) **States:** All India **Traditional Wear:** - Silk sarees - Traditional festive wear ### Karwa Chauth (October 21) **States:** North India **Traditional Wear:** - Red/pink sarees and lehengas - Traditional married women's attire ### Diwali (October 31 - November 4) **States:** All India **Traditional Wear:** - Silk sarees and designer blouses - Lehengas and salwar kameez - Kurta pajamas for men - Children's ethnic wear **Tailor Tip:** Biggest clothing season. Accept orders minimum 3 weeks in advance. Stock silk and brocade fabrics. ### Chhath Puja (November 6-7) **States:** Bihar, Jharkhand, UP **Traditional Wear:** - Yellow and red sarees - Traditional Bhojpuri wear ### Guru Nanak Jayanti (November 15) **States:** Punjab, All India **Traditional Wear:** - White and saffron outfits - Traditional Punjabi suits ### Christmas (December 25) **States:** All India, especially Kerala, Goa, Northeast **Traditional Wear:** - Western party wear - Gowns and dresses - Red and green themed outfits ## State-wise Festival Calendar Summary ### Andhra Pradesh & Telangana | Festival | Approximate Date | Peak Order Time | |----------|-----------------|----------------| | Sankranti | Jan 14 | Dec 20 - Jan 10 | | Baisakhi | Apr 14 | Apr 1 - Apr 12 | | Karwa Chauth | Oct 21 | Oct 5 - Oct 18 | | Diwali | Oct 31 | Oct 10 - Oct 25 | ## Business Planning Tips ### Three Months Before Major Festivals - Order specialty fabrics (silk, brocade, organza) - Stock up on popular blouse piece colors - Plan promotional offers ### One Month Before - Start accepting festival orders - Hire temporary help if needed - Extend working hours ### Two Weeks Before - Stop accepting new orders if backlog is high - Focus on completing existing orders - Prepare rush-order pricing ### Festival Week - Offer alteration services only - Keep shop open extended hours - Provide quick fixes and adjustments ## Popular Festival Clothing Combinations ### For Diwali/Navratri - Silk saree + designer blouse - Lehenga + crop top blouse - Anarkali suit sets ### For Pongal/Sankranti - Pattu saree + contrast blouse - Half saree sets - Traditional silk pavadai ### For Onam - Kasavu saree + boat neck blouse - Set mundu combinations - Traditional Kerala style blouses ## Conclusion Understanding India's festival calendar is essential for every tailor and boutique owner. Plan ahead, stock wisely, and manage your orders to make the most of these peak seasons. The key is starting preparations early and maintaining quality even during rush periods.
